channel.title: Why Do Compilers Say
channel.description:
... you're missing a semi-colon (;), when you've missed a quotation mark (")?
[code=java] client.getActionSender().sendQuest("Text here, 7332); [/code] ^ Example.

item.title: Why Do Compilers Say
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Yup, because you never close the string literal, the semicolon is interpreted as a part of the string and it’s normal effect is overwritten.

Locked on request.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Do Compilers Say
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:6, topic:405912”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=502901.msg3679278#msg3679278 date=1311428323]
Because it’s expecting a semi-colon at the end of the line??? the missing quote would mean that the rest of the line was part of the quote so I guess that’s how the compiler says the line is incomplete?
this calls for google!
[/quote]
That sounds logical to me.[/quote][quote=“T4_, post:7, topic:405912”]Because Text here, 7332); is interpreted as being a part of that string instance.[/quote]

i agree with both these.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Do Compilers Say
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Because Text here, 7332); is interpreted as being a part of that string instance.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Do Compilers Say
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

No I don’t need an error fixing. I mean when sometimes I compile and, by accident, miss a quotation mark, the compiler will say semi-colon expected, when in fact it’s a quotation mark.

Was just curious.

Read full topic

item.title: Why Do Compilers Say
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:1, topic:405912”]… you’re missing a semi-colon (;), when you’ve missed a quotation mark (")?

client.getActionSender().sendQuest("Text here, 7332);

^ Example.[/quote]

Where on the compiler does it say you’re missing a semi-colon?

Read full topic
